action.action-desc: Mr. Poe of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To restrict passports for travel to or use in certain countries, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ebola Prevention Act of 2014.

section.header: Restriction of passports for travel to or use in certain countries

subsection.text: Due to the imminent danger to the public health and pursuant to section 1 of the Act entitled An Act to regulate the issue and validity of passports, and for other purposes, approved July 3, 1926 (22 U.S.C. 211a), commonly known as the Passport Act of 1926, the Secretary of State shall designate all passports as restricted for travel to or for use in Guinea, Liberia, and Sierra Leone.

The restriction on passports described in subsection (a) shall not apply with respect to any travel to for use in Guinea, Liberia, or Sierra Leone the purpose of which the Secretary of State determines to be for diplomatic, health care, humanitarian, journalistic, or military reasons.

Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of State shall submit to the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate a report on the implementation of this Act.
